text:
Hi,

when doing a "kill -HUP" on the main apache process, or the command "apachectl 
restart", apache fails to restart with the error:

[Mon Apr 28 11:46:34 2003] [notice] SIGHUP received.  Attempting to restart
[Mon Apr 28 11:46:35 2003] [notice] seg fault or similar nasty error detected in
 the parent process

As a result, one httpd process is running and listens to port 80, but gives no 
documents back any more.

Apache compile rule:
./configure" --with-mpm=worker" --prefix=/opt/httpd-2.0.45" --enable-mods-
shared=all" --enable-ssl"

The extra module php is running on it as well.

Franky
creator: liedekef@pandora.be

text:
What is the OS?

Does the problem occur with no third-party modules loaded?

Was a core dump generated?  Look for one in the serverroot directory, or in the
location specified by the CoreDumpDirectory directive.  If you can get a
coredump, please post a backtrace.
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
The OS: redhat linux 8.0, updated kernel version: 2.4.18-27.8.0
No core was generated.
The problem did not occur when php (version: 4.3.1) was not loaded.
creator: liedekef@pandora.be
slive@apache.org
text:
I don't like to pass the buck, but since the problem occurs only with php
present, it is most likely a php problem.  Please take this to a php
mailing list and, if you get no response there, the php bug database.
